overview:
Mark Pors co-founded WatchMouse and worked as Lead Programmer from 2002 until 2003, when he assumed the role of Chief Technology Officer. Prior to co-founding WatchMouse, he served as the R&D Project Leader at Q-go, a specialized website search company.

Pors worked as a freelance Internet consultant and contractor prior to joining Q-go. He co-founded his first Internet company, Green Globe in 1999, and joined Keycorp Limited as a Sales Engineer in 1998. Mark worked as a Liaison Officer in 1997 for Chipper BV, a joint venture of KPN and ING, and was based in Sydney, Australia.

Pors began his career in 1992 at KPN Research as a Scientific Researcher specialized in embedded real-time hardware systems for telecommunication application. While at KPN, he moved from pure research to project management roles and in 1996, managed a major project for the development of smart card terminals and infrastructure for remote use (TeleChipper).

Pors received his Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Delft Technology Institute in Delft, The Netherlands.
